question: FYI – here’s a little twist: Gunter is counting jelly beans in a jar. One friend says 100. Another says 30 more than half of the first guess. A third says 30% more than the first one. What’s their average guess? Let’s do the math carefully.

By the way, here’s something interesting! A mechanic charges $70 per truck tire and $50 per car tire. On Thursday, they fix 5 truck tires and 3 car tires. On Friday, they fix 10 car tires only. How much more money was earned on the higher-revenue day?
Quick note before we jump in: Vincent can buy flower packs — 4 for $3 or 2 for $1.20. How much does he save if he buys 24 flowers at the better price? Think it through!

Just a heads-up: Gene is sewing a quilt. He’s been on 5 vacations per year since he was 22, and now he’s 34. Each trip gives one shirt for the quilt. How many quilt blocks does Gene have? Let’s calculate that!
Friendly reminder! Harry slept 10 hours last night. James slept only 2/3 of Harry’s time. How many more hours did Harry sleep than James?
Quick heads-up: John has 3 boxes, each 7 x 8 x 6 inches. The walls are 1 inch thick. What is the total inner volume of all 3 boxes?
FYI – here’s a fun one: Charlie has four times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. James has five times Dorothy’s count. If Charlie has 16 friends, how many friends does James have?
By the way, Carl buys 12 packs of cookies, each with 8 cookies, at $0.15 per cookie. How much change does Carl get from a $20 bill?

Quick note before we continue: Chad orders a burrito at $7.50, adds $2.50 for extra meat, $1.50 for cheese, $1.50 for avocado, and two sauces at $0.30 each. Meal upgrade: $3.50. He uses a $6.00 gift card. How much does he still owe?
Heads-up! Dax visits the farm and finds half as many bugs as 60 ants. What’s the total insect count?
FYI – a 48-page tabloid folds so that page 1 is left back, page 2 left front, page 48 right back, and page 47 right front. How many sheets of paper are used?
Just to note: Luke eats 3 hot dogs. Thomas eats twice as many. John eats half of Thomas’s count. How many more hot dogs does John eat than Luke?
By the way, a class of 240 students splits into 3 groups: 2 equal, one smaller by 15 students. How many are in the smallest group?
Reminder! Millie spends $24 on supplies to make 4 lemonade pitchers (12 cups each), sells at $1.50 per cup, averages 6 cups per hour. What’s her profit per hour if she sells out?
FYI – Gabriel’s media player holds 120 songs; he has 30. Luri has 2.5x as many songs. How many fewer songs can Luri add compared to Gabriel?
Heads-up: Southlandia’s highest temp: -40°F. Northlandia: 28°F. Midlandia: -2°F. What’s the average high temp?
Quick note: Sally buys a $9 pizza and a family-size pizza costing 2.5x more. How much does she spend total?
FYI – Jamaal lifts a 10-pound weight, increases by 40%, then drops 2 pounds. What’s the final weight he lifts?
By the way, Prince the butcher sells 20 kg/hour, works 8 hours/day. Bill’s bull weighs 960 kg. How many days to sell all the meat?
Just to note: Sally’s account started at $250, now at $470. Her weekly wage is $300. How many dollars were withheld?
FYI – Catherine visits the store: 1 kilo of apples for $5, 3 kilos of bananas at $2 per kilo, 2 kilos of oranges at $4 per kilo. How much does she pay in total?
By the way, Alex tutors 3 weeks at $15 per day. How much does she earn in total?
Quick note: Greg finds $25 walking with his 4 younger siblings. How much does each person get if they split it equally?
Reminder! In a student election, candidate A gets 25%, B gets 50% more than A, the rest go to C. If there are 120 voters, how many votes does C get?
Heads-up! Tanya earns $18 per hour plus $6 bonus if she teaches over 3 classes. Monday: 4 classes, 6 hours. Wednesday: 2 classes, 3 hours. Total earnings?
FYI – Jack and 3 friends play at a new arcade. Jack: 1 quarter for 15 minutes. Two friends play half as long, one plays 1.5x longer. They play 3 hours. Total cost?
By the way, Daisy buys 6 pounds of potatoes, sweet potatoes twice that, carrots 4 pounds less than sweet potatoes. How many pounds of carrots?
Quick reminder: 7 bottles of soda cost $24, 4 bottles of water cost $10. David wants 3 sodas and 2 waters. Total cost?
FYI – Lani bakes 60 cookies, eats 6, and splits the rest equally into 6 jars. How many cookies per jar?
By the way, James walks to the store 6 miles away, realizes halfway he forgot something and returns. Walking speed: 3 mph. How long to reach the store?
Quick note: A farmer bales 6 bales/hour, truck picks up 4 bales/hour. Over an 8-hour day, how many bales remain in the field?
FYI – Ellen shakes 4 of 15 soda cans. She takes 1 unshaken, brother takes 1 shaken and 3 unshaken. What’s the chance Ellen’s friend picks a shaken can (percent)?
Heads-up! Elijah’s dogs: one-third and half the weight of Kory’s 66-pound dog. Total combined weight?
By the way, Bernie’s 4 dogs need walks: 2, 5, and 4 miles. Average: 4 miles. How many miles does the last dog need?
FYI – John mortgages his $300,000 house, gets a loan for 50%. He uses 60% to pay debts. How much is left over?
By the way, it rained 3 inches on Monday and is expected to rain 1 inch more than twice Monday’s total on Tuesday. How many inches of rain on Tuesday?
Quick note: John invites 25 people to a party, each will eat 3 hot dogs. He already has 5 hot dogs. Hot dogs come in packs of 8, $3 per pack. How much does he need to spend?

FYI – Dr. Grumpus tells Igor to gather 20 test tubes, 8 beakers, 16 Petri dishes. Igor accidentally gets half as many test tubes, two more Petri dishes, correct beakers, but loses some. Total items on bench: 35. How many beakers were lost?
